verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, that certain of the elders of Israel came to enquire of the LORD, and sat before me.
verses.ct: In the 7th year, on the 10th day of the 5th month, some of Israel's elders came to seek an answer from the LORD, and they sat down in front of me.

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD unto me, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD's message came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, speak unto the elders of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Are ye come to enquire of me? As I live, saith the Lord GOD, I will not be enquired of by you.
verses.ct: "Son of man, speak to Israel's elders and tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Have you come to seek answers from me? As surely as I live,' declares the Lord GOD, 'I refuse to let you consult me.'"

verses.kjv: Wilt thou judge them, son of man, wilt thou judge them? cause them to know the abominations of their fathers:
verses.ct: "Will you pronounce judgment on them, son of man? Will you pronounce judgment on them? Make them aware of the disgusting practices of their ancestors."

verses.kjv: And say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; In the day when I chose Israel, and lifted up mine hand unto the seed of the house of Jacob, and made myself known unto them in the land of Egypt, when I lifted up mine hand unto them, saying, I am the LORD your God;
verses.ct: Tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: On the day I chose Israel, I raised my hand in an oath to the descendants of Jacob's household and revealed myself to them in the land of Egypt. I raised my hand and swore to them, saying, "I am the LORD your God."

verses.kjv: In the day that I lifted up mine hand unto them, to bring them forth of the land of Egypt into a land that I had espied for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands:
verses.ct: On that day I raised my hand and swore to bring them out of Egypt into a land I had searched out for them — a land flowing with milk and honey, the most beautiful of all lands.

verses.kjv: Then said I unto them, Cast ye away every man the abominations of his eyes, and defile not yourselves with the idols of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
verses.ct: I told them, "Each of you must throw away the disgusting idols you look at with longing, and do not make yourselves unclean with Egypt's idols. I am the LORD your God."

verses.kjv: But they rebelled against me, and would not hearken unto me: they did not every man cast away the abominations of their eyes, neither did they forsake the idols of Egypt: then I said, I will pour out my fury upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: But they rebelled against me and refused to listen. Not one of them threw away their disgusting idols, and they did not abandon Egypt's idols. So I declared that I would pour out my rage on them and fully unleash my anger against them right there in Egypt.

verses.kjv: But I wrought for my name’s sake, that it should not be polluted before the heathen, among whom they were, in whose sight I made myself known unto them, in bringing them forth out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: But I acted for the sake of my name, so that it would not be dishonored among the nations where they lived — the nations in whose presence I had revealed myself to Israel by bringing them out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I caused them to go forth out of the land of Egypt, and brought them into the wilderness.
verses.ct: So I led them out of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And I gave them my statutes, and shewed them my judgments, which if a man do, he shall even live in them.
verses.ct: I gave them my laws and made my regulations known to them — the rules that give life to anyone who follows them.

verses.kjv: Moreover also I gave them my sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am the LORD that sanctify them.
verses.ct: I also gave them my Sabbaths as a sign between me and them, so they would recognize that I am the LORD who makes them holy.

verses.kjv: But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness: they walked not in my statutes, and they despised my judgments, which if a man do, he shall even live in them; and my sabbaths they greatly polluted: then I said, I would pour out my fury upon them in the wilderness, to consume them.
verses.ct: But the people of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness. They did not follow my laws, and they rejected my regulations — the rules that give life to anyone who follows them. They severely violated my Sabbaths. So I declared that I would pour out my rage on them in the wilderness and destroy them completely.

verses.kjv: But I wrought for my name’s sake, that it should not be polluted before the heathen, in whose sight I brought them out.
verses.ct: But I acted for the sake of my name, so that it would not be dishonored among the nations who had watched me bring them out.

verses.kjv: Yet also I lifted up my hand unto them in the wilderness, that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all lands;
verses.ct: Yet I also raised my hand and swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land I had given them — a land flowing with milk and honey, the most beautiful of all lands —

verses.kjv: Because they despised my judgments, and walked not in my statutes, but polluted my sabbaths: for their heart went after their idols.
verses.ct: because they rejected my regulations, refused to follow my laws, and violated my Sabbaths. Their hearts were devoted to their idols.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless mine eye spared them from destroying them, neither did I make an end of them in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Still, I looked on them with compassion and did not destroy them. I did not put an end to them in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: But I said unto their children in the wilderness, Walk ye not in the statutes of your fathers, neither observe their judgments, nor defile yourselves with their idols:
verses.ct: Instead, I said to their children in the wilderness, "Do not follow the practices of your parents. Do not observe their regulations or make yourselves unclean with their idols.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD your God; walk in my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them;
verses.ct: I am the LORD your God. Follow my laws, carefully observe my regulations, and carry them out.

verses.kjv: And hallow my sabbaths; and they shall be a sign between me and you, that ye may know that I am the LORD your God.
verses.ct: Treat my Sabbaths as holy. They will serve as a sign between me and you, so that you will recognize that I am the LORD your God."

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding the children rebelled against me: they walked not in my statutes, neither kept my judgments to do them, which if a man do, he shall even live in them; they polluted my sabbaths: then I said, I would pour out my fury upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the wilderness.
verses.ct: But their children also rebelled against me. They did not follow my laws or carefully observe my regulations — the rules that give life to anyone who follows them. They violated my Sabbaths. So I declared that I would pour out my rage on them and fully unleash my anger against them in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless I withdrew mine hand, and wrought for my name’s sake, that it should not be polluted in the sight of the heathen, in whose sight I brought them forth.
verses.ct: But I held back and acted for the sake of my name, so that it would not be dishonored among the nations who had watched me bring them out.

verses.kjv: I lifted up mine hand unto them also in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the heathen, and disperse them through the countries;
verses.ct: I also raised my hand and swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and spread them across foreign lands,

verses.kjv: Because they had not executed my judgments, but had despised my statutes, and had polluted my sabbaths, and their eyes were after their fathers’ idols.
verses.ct: because they had not obeyed my regulations but had rejected my laws, violated my Sabbaths, and kept their eyes fixed on their ancestors' idols.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I gave them also statutes that were not good, and judgments whereby they should not live;
verses.ct: So I also allowed them to follow laws that were not good and regulations that could not give them life.

verses.kjv: And I polluted them in their own gifts, in that they caused to pass through the fire all that openeth the womb, that I might make them desolate, to the end that they might know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: I let them become defiled through their own offerings — when they sacrificed every firstborn child in the fire — so that I might devastate them and make them recognize that I am the LORD.'

verses.kjv: Therefore, son of man, speak unto the house of Israel, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Yet in this your fathers have blasphemed me, in that they have committed a trespass against me.
verses.ct: "Therefore, son of man, speak to the people of Israel and tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: In yet another way your ancestors insulted me by being unfaithful to me.

verses.kjv: For when I had brought them into the land, for the which I lifted up mine hand to give it to them, then they saw every high hill, and all the thick trees, and they offered there their sacrifices, and there they presented the provocation of their offering: there also they made their sweet savour, and poured out there their drink offerings.
verses.ct: When I brought them into the land that I had raised my hand and sworn to give them, they looked at every high hill and every leafy tree, and there they offered their sacrifices. There they presented their offensive offerings, there they burned their pleasing aromas, and there they poured out their drink offerings.

verses.kjv: Then I said unto them, What is the high place whereunto ye go? And the name thereof is called Bamah unto this day.
verses.ct: I asked them, "What is this high place you keep going to?" And it has been called Bamah to this day.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore say unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Are ye polluted after the manner of your fathers? and commit ye whoredom after their abominations?
verses.ct: "So say to the people of Israel, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Are you going to defile yourselves the same way your ancestors did? Are you going to prostitute yourselves with their disgusting practices?

verses.kjv: For when ye offer your gifts, when ye make your sons to pass through the fire, ye pollute yourselves with all your idols, even unto this day: and shall I be enquired of by you, O house of Israel? As I live, saith the Lord GOD, I will not be enquired of by you.
verses.ct: When you present your offerings and pass your sons through the fire, you continue to defile yourselves with all your idols to this very day. Should I let you consult me, people of Israel? As surely as I live,' declares the Lord GOD, 'I refuse to let you consult me.

verses.kjv: And that which cometh into your mind shall not be at all, that ye say, We will be as the heathen, as the families of the countries, to serve wood and stone.
verses.ct: What you have in mind will never happen — when you say, "We want to be like the other nations, like the peoples of other countries, worshiping wood and stone."'

verses.kjv: As I live, saith the Lord GOD, surely with a mighty hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with fury poured out, will I rule over you:
verses.ct: "As surely as I live," declares the Lord GOD, "I will rule over you with a powerful hand, an outstretched arm, and outpoured rage.

verses.kjv: And I will bring you out from the people, and will gather you out of the countries wherein ye are scattered, with a mighty hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with fury poured out.
verses.ct: I will bring you out from the nations and gather you from the countries where you have been scattered, with a powerful hand, an outstretched arm, and outpoured rage.

verses.kjv: And I will bring you into the wilderness of the people, and there will I plead with you face to face.
verses.ct: I will bring you into the wilderness of the nations, and there I will judge you directly, in person.

verses.kjv: Like as I pleaded with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I plead with you, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: Just as I judged your ancestors in the wilderness near Egypt, so I will judge you," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: And I will cause you to pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant:
verses.ct: "I will make you pass under the shepherd's rod and bring you into the obligation of the covenant.

verses.kjv: And I will purge out from among you the rebels, and them that transgress against me: I will bring them forth out of the country where they sojourn, and they shall not enter into the land of Israel: and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: I will purge out the rebels from among you — those who sin against me. I will bring them out of the countries where they are living, but they will never set foot in the land of Israel. Then you will recognize that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: As for you, O house of Israel, thus saith the Lord GOD; Go ye, serve ye every one his idols, and hereafter also, if ye will not hearken unto me: but pollute ye my holy name no more with your gifts, and with your idols.
verses.ct: "As for you, people of Israel," says the Lord GOD, "go ahead — every one of you, keep serving your idols, now and in the future, if you refuse to listen to me! But stop dishonoring my holy name with your offerings and your idols.

verses.kjv: For in mine holy mountain, in the mountain of the height of Israel, saith the Lord GOD, there shall all the house of Israel, all of them in the land, serve me: there will I accept them, and there will I require your offerings, and the firstfruits of your oblations, with all your holy things.
verses.ct: On my holy mountain, the high mountain of Israel," declares the Lord GOD, "the entire nation of Israel — all of them throughout the land — will serve me there. There I will accept them, and there I will require your contributions and the best of your offerings, along with all your holy gifts.

verses.kjv: I will accept you with your sweet savour, when I bring you out from the people, and gather you out of the countries wherein ye have been scattered; and I will be sanctified in you before the heathen.
verses.ct: I will accept you like a pleasing aroma when I bring you out from the nations and gather you from the countries where you have been scattered. Through you I will demonstrate my holiness in the sight of the nations.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I am the LORD, when I shall bring you into the land of Israel, into the country for the which I lifted up mine hand to give it to your fathers.
verses.ct: You will recognize that I am the LORD when I bring you into the land of Israel — the country that I raised my hand and swore to give to your ancestors.

verses.kjv: And there shall ye remember your ways, and all your doings, wherein ye have been defiled; and ye shall lothe yourselves in your own sight for all your evils that ye have committed.
verses.ct: There you will remember your past behavior and all the things you did that made you unclean, and you will be disgusted with yourselves because of all the evil you committed.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I am the LORD, when I have wrought with you for my name’s sake, not according to your wicked ways, nor according to your corrupt doings, O ye house of Israel, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: You will recognize that I am the LORD when I deal with you for the sake of my name — not according to your wicked behavior or your corrupt actions, people of Israel," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face toward the south, and drop thy word toward the south, and prophesy against the forest of the south field;
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn toward the south and speak your message against the south. Prophesy against the forest region of the southern land.

verses.kjv: And say to the forest of the south, Hear the word of the LORD; Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will kindle a fire in thee, and it shall devour every green tree in thee, and every dry tree: the flaming flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from the south to the north shall be burned therein.
verses.ct: Say to the southern forest, 'Listen to the LORD's message. This is what the Lord GOD says: Pay attention — I am about to start a fire in you that will consume every green tree and every dry tree. The blazing flames will not be put out, and every surface from south to north will be scorched by it.

verses.kjv: And all flesh shall see that I the LORD have kindled it: it shall not be quenched.
verses.ct: Everyone will see that I, the LORD, have set it ablaze. It will not be extinguished.'"

verses.kjv: Then said I, Ah Lord GOD! they say of me, Doth he not speak parables?
verses.ct: Then I said, "Oh, Lord GOD! People are saying about me, 'Isn't he just speaking in riddles?'"
